entry.title: Armenia establishes border commission, joint meeting with Azerbaijan expected soon

media:group.media:title: Armenia establishes border commission, joint meeting with Azerbaijan expected soon
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan has signed a decree establishing a commission on border security and delimitation between Armenia and Azerbaijan. üìçAnti-government protesters in Yerevan have blocked the entrance to the Armenian Foreign Ministry. üìç6,500 people have been hired in Armenia‚Äôs IT firms since April 2021, according to Economy Minister Vahan Kerobyan.

entry.title: COAF‚Äôs new Health and Tourism Center in Armenia‚Äôs Lori region

media:group.media:title: COAF‚Äôs new Health and Tourism Center in Armenia‚Äôs Lori region
media:group.media:description:
In Armenia‚Äôs northern Lori region, the Children of Armenia Fund (COAF) has been actively implementing various projects. One of their initiatives is a health care center near Dsegh village, while another is a visitor‚Äôs center that will provide much needed tourism infrastructure to the area. COAF has also been working on transforming Lori‚Äôs Debet village into a smart village, a global modern approach to rural development that provides innovative solutions to the resident‚Äôs needs. Apart from establishing an educational smart center in Lori, the organization has announced that it plans to open a second smart center in Armenia, this one in the southern Armavir region. #CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’©

entry.title: Pashinyan meets Aliyev in Brussels to talk Karabakh negotiations

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan meets Aliyev in Brussels to talk Karabakh negotiations
media:group.media:description:
Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev agreed to convene a border commission in the near future and meet again in Brussels by August.
Deputy Prime Minister Mher Grigoryan hosted Ambassador Andrzej Kasprzyk, the OSCE representative to the Minsk Group, for talks in Yerevan.
Separately, Grigoryan ruled out holding early parliamentary elections in Armenia, despite repeated calls from the political opposition for Pashinyan to resign.
The Ministry of Health confirmed that it has not yet recorded any cases of monkeypox in Armenia. At least a dozen countries have reported cases of the rare virus so far.
In addition, the Health Ministry updated its COVID-19 figures, with the total number of vaccines administered in Armenia now nearing 2.2 million.
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #DailyArmenia

entry.title: How to bring together Armenia and the diaspora to benefit both

media:group.media:title: How to bring together Armenia and the diaspora to benefit both
media:group.media:description:
Noubar Afeyan, the Co-founder of ARMENIA 2041 Foundation and Founder and CEO of Flagship Pioneering, talks to CivilNet‚Äôs Eric Hacopian about past mistakes in Armenia-Diaspora relations and how best to bring the two together. Afeyan also discusses the importance of Armenia‚Äôs educational institutions in shaping the country‚Äôs pubfuture, and ways to attract investors to the country.
